<div class="vector-body" id="bodyContent">

<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Capital and largest city of France</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1033289096">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}</style><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">This article is about the capital of France. For other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/Paris_(disambiguation)" title="Paris (disambiguation)">Paris (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/75/Flag_of_Paris_with_coat_of_arms.svg/200px-Flag_of_Paris_with_coat_of_arms.svg.png 2x" width="100"/></a><div class="ib-settlement-caption-link"><a href="/wiki/Flag_of_Paris" title="Flag of Paris">Flag</a></div></div><div class="ib-settlement-cols-cell"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Grandes_Armes_de_Paris.svg" title="Coat of arms of Paris"><img alt="Coat of arms of Paris" data-file-height="1182" data-file-width="995" decoding="async" height="80" href="/wiki/Coat_of_arms_of_Paris" title="Coat of arms of Paris">Coat of arms</a></div></div></div></div></td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><td class="infobox-full-data" colspan="2">Motto(s): <div class="ib-settlement-nickname nickname"><span title="Latin-language text"><i lang="la"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fluctuat_nec_mergitur" title="Fluctuat nec mergitur">Fluctuat nec mergitur</a></i></span><br/><span style="font-size:85%;">"Tossed by the waves but never sunk"</span></div></td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><td class="infobox-full-data" colspan="2"><div class="mw-collapsible mw-collapsed" style="box-sizing:border-box;width:100%;font-size:95%;padding:4px;border:none;"><div style="font-size:100%;line-height:1.6;font-weight:bold;background:transparent;text-align:center;;height:5px;">Location of Paris</div><div class="mw-collapsible-content" style="background:transparent;text-align:left;;">

<p><b>Paris</b> (<small>French pronunciation: ​</small><span class="IPA" lang="fr-Latn-fonipa" title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/French" title="Help:IPA/French">[paʁi]</a></span> <span class="nowrap" style="font-size:85%">(<span class="unicode haudio"><span class="fn"><span style="white-space:nowrap;margin-right:.25em;"><a href="/wiki/File:Paris_Pronunciation_in_French_by_James_Tamim.ogg" title="About this sound"><img alt="" data-file-height="20" data-file-width="20" decoding="async" height="11" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/11px-Loudspeaker.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/17px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Loudspeaker.svg/22px-Loudspeaker.svg.png 2x" width="11"/></a></span><a class="internal" href="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/fd/Paris_Pronunciation_in_French_by_James_Tamim.ogg" title="Paris Pronunciation in French by James Tamim.ogg">listen</a></span></span>)</span>) is the <a href="/wiki/Capital_city" title="Capital city">capital</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_communes_in_France_with_over_20,000_inhabitants" title="List of communes in France with over 20,000 inhabitants">most populous city</a> of <a href="/wiki/France" title="France">France</a>, with an estimated <a href="/wiki/Population" title="Population">population</a> of 2,165,423 residents in 2019 in an area of more than 105 km² (41 sq mi),<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pop2019_4-0"><a href="#cite_note-pop2019-4">[4]</a></sup> making it the 34th most densely populated city in the world in 2020.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-5"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup> Since the 17th century, Paris has been one of the world's major centres of <a href="/wiki/Finance" title="Finance">finance</a>, <a href="/wiki/Diplomacy" title="Diplomacy">diplomacy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Commerce" title="Commerce">commerce</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fashion_capital" title="Fashion capital">fashion</a>, <a href="/wiki/Gastronomy" title="Gastronomy">gastronomy</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Science" title="Science">science</a>. For its leading role in the arts and sciences, as well as its very early system of street lighting, in the 19th century it became known as "the City of Light".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-6"><a href="#cite_note-6">[6]</a></sup> Like <a href="/wiki/London" title="London">London</a>, prior to the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Second_World_War" title="Second World War">Second World War</a>, it was also sometimes called <a href="/wiki/Caput_Mundi#Paris" title="Caput Mundi">the capital of the world</a>. 
</p><p>The City of Paris is the centre of the <a href="/wiki/Regions_of_France" title="Regions of France">region</a> and <a href="/wiki/Provinces_of_France" title="Provinces of France">province</a> of <a href="/wiki/%C3%8Ele-de-France" title="Île-de-France">Île-de-France</a>, or Paris Region, with an estimated population of 12,262,544 in 2019, or about 19% of the population of France.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IDF_pop_7-0"><a href="#cite_note-IDF_pop-7">[7]</a></sup> The Paris Region had a <a href="/wiki/Gross_domestic_product" title="Gross domestic product">GDP</a> of €739 billion ($743 billion) in 2019, which is the highest in Europe.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/Economist_Intelligence_Unit" title="Economist Intelligence Unit">Economist Intelligence Unit</a> Worldwide Cost of Living Survey, in 2021, Paris was the city with the second-highest cost of living in the world, tied with <a href="/wiki/Singapore" title="Singapore">Singapore</a>, and after <a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup>
</p><p>Paris is a major railway, highway, and air-transport hub served by two international airports: <a href="/wiki/Charles_de_Gaulle_Airport" title="Charles de Gaulle Airport">Paris–Charles de Gaulle</a> (the second-busiest airport in Europe) and <a href="/wiki/Orly_Airport" title="Orly Airport">Paris–Orly</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10"><a href="#cite_note-10">[10]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11"><a href="#cite_note-11">[11]</a></sup> Opened in 1900, the city's subway system, the <a href="/wiki/Paris_M%C3%A9tro" title="Paris Métro">Paris Métro</a>, serves 5.23 million passengers daily;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12"><a href="#cite_note-12">[12]</a></sup> it is the second-busiest metro system in Europe after the <a href="/wiki/Moscow_Metro" title="Moscow Metro">Moscow Metro</a>. <a href="/wiki/Gare_du_Nord" title="Gare du Nord">Gare du Nord</a> is the 24th-busiest railway station in the world and the busiest located outside <a href="/wiki/Japan" title="Japan">Japan</a>, with 262 million passengers in 2015.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-13"><a href="#cite_note-13">[13]</a></sup> Paris is especially known for its museums and architectural landmarks: the <a href="/wiki/Louvre" title="Louvre">Louvre</a> received 2.8 million visitors in 2021, despite the long museum closings caused by the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19" title="COVID-19">COVID-19</a> virus.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14"><a href="#cite_note-14">[14]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_d%27Orsay" title="Musée d'Orsay">Musée d'Orsay</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_Marmottan_Monet" title="Musée Marmottan Monet">Musée Marmottan Monet</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_de_l%27Orangerie" title="Musée de l'Orangerie">Musée de l'Orangerie</a> are noted for their collections of French <a href="/wiki/Impressionism" title="Impressionism">Impressionist</a> art. The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pompidou_Centre" title="Pompidou Centre">Pompidou Centre</a> <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_National_d%27Art_Moderne" title="Musée National d'Art Moderne">Musée National d'Art Moderne</a> has the largest collection of <a href="/wiki/Modern_art" title="Modern art">modern</a> and <a href="/wiki/Contemporary_art" title="Contemporary art">contemporary art</a> in Europe. The <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_Rodin" title="Musée Rodin">Musée Rodin</a> and <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_Picasso" title="Musée Picasso">Musée Picasso</a> exhibit the works of two noted Parisians. The historical district along the Seine in the city centre has been classified as a <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a> <a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">World Heritage Site</a> since 1991; popular landmarks there include the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Notre_Dame_de_Paris" title="Notre Dame de Paris">Cathedral of Notre Dame de Paris</a> on the <a href="/wiki/%C3%8Ele_de_la_Cit%C3%A9" title="Île de la Cité">Île de la Cité</a>, now closed for renovation after the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Notre-Dame_de_Paris_fire" title="Notre-Dame de Paris fire">15 April 2019 fire</a>. Other popular tourist sites include the Gothic royal chapel of <a href="/wiki/Sainte-Chapelle" title="Sainte-Chapelle">Sainte-Chapelle</a>, also on the Île de la Cité; the <a href="/wiki/Eiffel_Tower" title="Eiffel Tower">Eiffel Tower</a>, constructed for the <a href="/wiki/Exposition_Universelle_(1889)" title="Exposition Universelle (1889)">Paris Universal Exposition of 1889</a>; the <a href="/wiki/Grand_Palais" title="Grand Palais">Grand Palais</a> and <a href="/wiki/Petit_Palais" title="Petit Palais">Petit Palais</a>, built for the <a href="/wiki/Exposition_Universelle_(1900)" title="Exposition Universelle (1900)">Paris Universal Exposition of 1900</a>; the <a href="/wiki/Arc_de_Triomphe" title="Arc de Triomphe">Arc de Triomphe</a> on the <a href="/wiki/Champs-%C3%89lys%C3%A9es" title="Champs-Élysées">Champs-Élysées</a>, and the hill of <a href="/wiki/Montmartre" title="Montmartre">Montmartre</a> with its artistic history and its <a href="/wiki/Sacr%C3%A9-C%C5%93ur,_Paris" title="Sacré-Cœur, Paris">Basilica of Sacré-Coeur</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-unesco_15-0"><a href="#cite_note-unesco-15">[15]</a></sup>
</p><p>Paris hosts several <a href="/wiki/United_Nations" title="United Nations">United Nations</a> organisations including <a href="/wiki/UNESCO" title="UNESCO">UNESCO</a>, and other international organisations such as the <a href="/wiki/OECD" title="OECD">OECD</a>, the <a href="/wiki/OECD_Development_Centre" title="OECD Development Centre">OECD Development Centre</a>, the <a href="/wiki/International_Bureau_of_Weights_and_Measures" title="International Bureau of Weights and Measures">International Bureau of Weights and Measures</a>, the <a href="/wiki/International_Energy_Agency" title="International Energy Agency">International Energy Agency</a>, the <a href="/wiki/International_Federation_for_Human_Rights" title="International Federation for Human Rights">International Federation for Human Rights</a>, along with European bodies such as the <a href="/wiki/European_Space_Agency" title="European Space Agency">European Space Agency</a>, the <a href="/wiki/European_Banking_Authority" title="European Banking Authority">European Banking Authority</a> or the <a href="/wiki/European_Securities_and_Markets_Authority" title="European Securities and Markets Authority">European Securities and Markets Authority</a>. 
</p><p>The <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">football</a> club <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Rugby_union" title="Rugby union">rugby union</a> club <a href="/wiki/Stade_Fran%C3%A7ais" title="Stade Français">Stade Français</a> are based in Paris. The 80,000-seat <a href="/wiki/Stade_de_France" title="Stade de France">Stade de France</a>, built for the <a href="/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1998 FIFA World Cup">1998 FIFA World Cup</a>, is located just north of Paris in the neighbouring commune of <a href="/wiki/Saint-Denis,_Seine-Saint-Denis" title="Saint-Denis, Seine-Saint-Denis">Saint-Denis</a>. Paris hosts the annual <a href="/wiki/French_Open" title="French Open">French Open</a> <a href="/wiki/Grand_Slam_(tennis)" title="Grand Slam (tennis)">Grand Slam</a> <a href="/wiki/Tennis" title="Tennis">tennis</a> tournament on the red clay of <a href="/wiki/Stade_Roland_Garros" title="Stade Roland Garros">Roland Garros</a>. The city hosted the Olympic Games in <a href="/wiki/1900_Summer_Olympics" title="1900 Summer Olympics">1900</a>, <a href="/wiki/1924_Summer_Olympics" title="1924 Summer Olympics">1924</a> and will host the <a href="/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics" title="2024 Summer Olympics">2024 Summer Olympics</a>. The <a href="/wiki/1938_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1938 FIFA World Cup">1938</a> and <a href="/wiki/1998_FIFA_World_Cup" title="1998 FIFA World Cup">1998 FIFA World Cups</a>, the <a href="/wiki/2007_Rugby_World_Cup" title="2007 Rugby World Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a>, as well as the <a href="/wiki/1960_European_Nations%27_Cup" title="1960 European Nations' Cup">1960</a>, <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_1984" title="UEFA Euro 1984">1984</a> and <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Euro_2016" title="UEFA Euro 2016">2016</a> <a href="/wiki/UEFA_European_Championship" title="UEFA European Championship">UEFA European Championships</a> were also held in the city. Every July, the <a href="/wiki/Tour_de_France" title="Tour de France">Tour de France</a> <a href="/wiki/Road_bicycle_racing" title="Road bicycle racing">bicycle race</a> finishes on the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Avenue_des_Champs-%C3%89lys%C3%A9es" title="Avenue des Champs-Élysées">Avenue des Champs-Élysées</a> in Paris. 
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-3"><div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>
