</p><p>Between 1853 and 1870, Emperor <a href="/wiki/Napoleon_III" title="Napoleon III">Napoleon III</a> and the city's first director of parks and gardens, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Jean-Charles_Adolphe_Alphand" title="Jean-Charles Adolphe Alphand">Jean-Charles Adolphe Alphand</a>, created the <a href="/wiki/Bois_de_Boulogne" title="Bois de Boulogne">Bois de Boulogne</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bois_de_Vincennes" title="Bois de Vincennes">Bois de Vincennes</a>, <a href="/wiki/Parc_Montsouris" title="Parc Montsouris">Parc Montsouris</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Parc_des_Buttes-Chaumont" title="Parc des Buttes-Chaumont">Parc des Buttes-Chaumont</a>, located at the four points of the compass around the city, as well as many smaller parks, squares and gardens in the Paris's quarters.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEJarrassé2007122–161_328-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJarrassé2007122–161-328">[327]</a></sup> Since 1977, the city has created 166 new parks, most notably the <a href="/wiki/Parc_de_la_Villette" title="Parc de la Villette">Parc de la Villette</a> (1987), <a href="/wiki/Parc_Andr%C3%A9_Citro%C3%ABn" title="Parc André Citroën">Parc André Citroën</a> (1992), <a href="/wiki/Parc_de_Bercy" title="Parc de Bercy">Parc de Bercy</a> (1997) and <a href="/wiki/Parc_Clichy-Batignolles_%E2%80%93_Martin-Luther-King" title="Parc Clichy-Batignolles – Martin-Luther-King">Parc Clichy-Batignolles</a> (2007).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEJarrassé2007242–256_329-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEJarrassé2007242–256-329">[328]</a></sup> One of the newest parks, the <a href="/wiki/Promenade_des_Berges_de_la_Seine" title="Promenade des Berges de la Seine">Promenade des Berges de la Seine</a> (2013), built on a former highway on the <a href="/wiki/Rive_Gauche" title="Rive Gauche">left bank</a> of the Seine between the <a href="/wiki/Pont_de_l%27Alma" title="Pont de l'Alma">Pont de l'Alma</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Mus%C3%A9e_d%27Orsay" title="Musée d'Orsay">Musée d'Orsay</a>, has floating gardens and gives a view of the city's landmarks.
</p><p>Weekly <a href="/wiki/Parkrun" title="Parkrun">Parkruns</a> take place in the Bois de Boulogne and the Parc Montsouris<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-330"><a href="#cite_note-330">[329]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-331"><a href="#cite_note-331">[330]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Cemeteries">Cemeteries</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=56" title="Edit section: Cemeteries">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1975" data-file-width="3145" decoding="async" height="138" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg/220px-Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg/330px-Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e1/Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg/440px-Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Catacombes_De_Paris.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Catacombs_of_Paris" title="Catacombs of Paris">Paris Catacombs</a> hold the remains of approximately 6 million people.</div></div></div>
<p>During the Roman era, the city's main cemetery was located to the outskirts of the <a href="/wiki/Rive_Gauche" title="Rive Gauche">left bank</a> settlement, but this changed with the rise of Catholic Christianity, where most every inner-city church had adjoining burial grounds for use by their parishes. With Paris's growth many of these, particularly the city's largest cemetery, the <a href="/wiki/Holy_Innocents%27_Cemetery" title="Holy Innocents' Cemetery">Holy Innocents' Cemetery</a>, were filled to overflowing, creating quite unsanitary conditions for the capital. When inner-city burials were condemned from 1786, the contents of all Paris's parish cemeteries were transferred to a renovated section of <a href="/wiki/Mines_of_Paris" title="Mines of Paris">Paris's stone mines</a> outside the "Porte d'Enfer" city gate, today <a href="/wiki/Place_Denfert-Rochereau" title="Place Denfert-Rochereau">place Denfert-Rochereau</a> in the 14th arrondissement.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEWhaley2012101_332-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEWhaley2012101-332">[331]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEBroadwell200792_333-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEBroadwell200792-333">[332]</a></sup> The process of moving bones from the <i><a href="/wiki/Holy_Innocents%27_Cemetery" title="Holy Innocents' Cemetery">Cimetière des Innocents</a></i> to the <a href="/wiki/Catacombs_of_Paris" title="Catacombs of Paris">catacombs</a> took place between 1786 and 1814;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEAndiaBrialy2001221_334-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEAndiaBrialy2001221-334">[333]</a></sup> part of the network of tunnels and remains can be visited today on the official tour of the catacombs.
</p><p>After a tentative creation of several smaller suburban cemeteries, the Prefect Nicholas Frochot under <a href="/wiki/Napoleon" title="Napoleon">Napoleon</a> Bonaparte provided a more definitive solution in the creation of three massive Parisian cemeteries outside the city limits.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-FOOTNOTEAyers2004271_335-0"><a href="#cite_note-FOOTNOTEAyers2004271-335">[334]</a></sup> Open from 1804, these were the cemeteries of <a href="/wiki/P%C3%A8re_Lachaise_Cemetery" title="Père Lachaise Cemetery">Père Lachaise</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montmartre_Cemetery" title="Montmartre Cemetery">Montmartre</a>, <a href="/wiki/Montparnasse_Cemetery" title="Montparnasse Cemetery">Montparnasse</a>, and later <a href="/wiki/Passy_Cemetery" title="Passy Cemetery">Passy</a>; these cemeteries became inner-city once again when Paris annexed all neighbouring communes to the inside of its much larger ring of suburban fortifications in 1860. New suburban cemeteries were created in the early 20th century: The largest of these are the <a href="/wiki/Saint-Ouen_Cemetery" title="Saint-Ouen Cemetery">Cimetière parisien de Saint-Ouen</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Cimeti%C3%A8re_parisien_de_Pantin" title="Cimetière parisien de Pantin">Cimetière parisien de Pantin</a> (also known as Cimetière parisien de <a href="/wiki/Pantin" title="Pantin">Pantin</a>-<a href="/wiki/Bobigny" title="Bobigny">Bobigny</a>), the Cimetière parisien d'<a href="/wiki/Ivry-sur-Seine" title="Ivry-sur-Seine">Ivry</a>, and the Cimetière parisien de <a href="/wiki/Bagneux,_Hauts-de-Seine" title="Bagneux, Hauts-de-Seine">Bagneux</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Parisian_Cemeteries_336-0"><a href="#cite_note-Parisian_Cemeteries-336">[335]</a></sup> Some of the most famous people in the world are buried in Parisian cemeteries, such as <a href="/wiki/Oscar_Wilde" title="Oscar Wilde">Oscar Wilde</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fr%C3%A9d%C3%A9ric_Chopin" title="Frédéric Chopin">Frédéric Chopin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jim_Morrison" title="Jim Morrison">Jim Morrison</a>, <a href="/wiki/%C3%89dith_Piaf" title="Édith Piaf">Édith Piaf</a> and <a href="/wiki/Serge_Gainsbourg" title="Serge Gainsbourg">Serge Gainsbourg</a> among others.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-337"><a href="#cite_note-337">[336]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Healthcare">Healthcare</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=57" title="Edit section: Healthcare">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris,_February_7,_2013.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4500" data-file-width="4500" decoding="async" height="220" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg/220px-H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg/330px-H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/71/H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg/440px-H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris%2C_February_7%2C_2013.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris,_February_7,_2013.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The Hôtel-Dieu de Paris, the oldest hospital in the city</div></div></div>
<p>Health care and emergency medical service in the City of Paris and its suburbs are provided by the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Assistance_publique_%E2%80%93_H%C3%B4pitaux_de_Paris" title="Assistance publique – Hôpitaux de Paris">Assistance publique – Hôpitaux de Paris</a> (AP-HP), a public hospital system that employs more than 90,000 people (including practitioners, support personnel, and administrators) in 44 hospitals.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-hospital_338-0"><a href="#cite_note-hospital-338">[337]</a></sup> It is the largest hospital system in Europe. It provides health care, teaching, research, prevention, education and emergency medical service in 52 branches of medicine. The hospitals receive more than 5.8 million annual patient visits.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-hospital_338-1"><a href="#cite_note-hospital-338">[337]</a></sup>
</p><p>One of the most notable hospitals is the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/H%C3%B4tel-Dieu_de_Paris" title="Hôtel-Dieu de Paris">Hôtel-Dieu</a>, founded in 651, the oldest hospital in the city,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-339"><a href="#cite_note-339">[338]</a></sup> although the current building is the product of a reconstruction of 1877. Other hospitals include <a href="/wiki/Piti%C3%A9-Salp%C3%AAtri%C3%A8re_Hospital" title="Pitié-Salpêtrière Hospital">Pitié-Salpêtrière Hospital</a> (one of the largest in Europe), <a href="/wiki/H%C3%B4pital_Cochin" title="Hôpital Cochin">Hôpital Cochin</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bichat%E2%80%93Claude_Bernard_Hospital" title="Bichat–Claude Bernard Hospital">Bichat–Claude Bernard Hospital</a>, <a href="/wiki/H%C3%B4pital_Europ%C3%A9en_Georges-Pompidou" title="Hôpital Européen Georges-Pompidou">Hôpital Européen Georges-Pompidou</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bic%C3%AAtre_Hospital" title="Bicêtre Hospital">Bicêtre Hospital</a>, <a href="/wiki/Beaujon_Hospital" title="Beaujon Hospital">Beaujon Hospital</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Curie_Institute_(Paris)" title="Curie Institute (Paris)">Curie Institute</a>, <a href="/wiki/Lariboisi%C3%A8re_Hospital" title="Lariboisière Hospital">Lariboisière Hospital</a>, <a href="/wiki/Necker%E2%80%93Enfants_Malades_Hospital" title="Necker–Enfants Malades Hospital">Necker–Enfants Malades Hospital</a>, <a href="/wiki/H%C3%B4pital_Saint-Louis" title="Hôpital Saint-Louis">Hôpital Saint-Louis</a>, <a href="/wiki/H%C3%B4pital_de_la_Charit%C3%A9" title="Hôpital de la Charité">Hôpital de la Charité</a> and the <a href="/wiki/American_Hospital_of_Paris" title="American Hospital of Paris">American Hospital of Paris</a>.
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Media">Media</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=58" title="Edit section: Media">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Agence_France_Presse.JPG"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2000" data-file-width="3008" decoding="async" height="146" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Agence_France_Presse.JPG/220px-Agence_France_Presse.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Agence_France_Presse.JPG/330px-Agence_France_Presse.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/Agence_France_Presse.JPG/440px-Agence_France_Presse.JPG 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Agence_France_Presse.JPG" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Agence France-Presse Headquarters in Paris</div></div></div>
<p>Paris and its close suburbs are home to numerous newspapers, magazines and publications including <i><a href="/wiki/Le_Monde" title="Le Monde">Le Monde</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Le_Figaro" title="Le Figaro">Le Figaro</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Lib%C3%A9ration" title="Libération">Libération</a></i>, <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Le_Nouvel_Observateur" title="Le Nouvel Observateur">Le Nouvel Observateur</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Le_Canard_encha%C3%AEn%C3%A9" title="Le Canard enchaîné">Le Canard enchaîné</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/La_Croix" title="La Croix">La Croix</a></i>, <i><a href="/wiki/Le_Parisien" title="Le Parisien">Le Parisien</a></i> (in <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Saint-Ouen,_Seine-Saint-Denis" title="Saint-Ouen, Seine-Saint-Denis">Saint-Ouen</a></i>), <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Les_%C3%89chos_(France)" title="Les Échos (France)">Les Échos</a></i>, <i>Paris Match (<a href="/wiki/Neuilly-sur-Seine" title="Neuilly-sur-Seine">Neuilly-sur-Seine</a>)</i>, <i>Réseaux &amp; Télécoms</i>, <a href="/wiki/Reuters" title="Reuters">Reuters</a> France, <a href="/wiki/L%27%C3%89quipe" title="L'Équipe">l'Equipe</a> (<a href="/wiki/Boulogne-Billancourt" title="Boulogne-Billancourt">Boulogne-Billancourt</a>) and <i>L'Officiel des Spectacles</i>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-340"><a href="#cite_note-340">[339]</a></sup> France's two most prestigious newspapers, <i>Le Monde</i> and <i>Le Figaro</i>, are the centrepieces of the Parisian publishing industry.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-341"><a href="#cite_note-341">[340]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Agence_France-Presse" title="Agence France-Presse">Agence France-Presse</a> is France's oldest, and one of the world's oldest, continually operating news agencies. AFP, as it is colloquially abbreviated, maintains its headquarters in Paris, as it has since 1835.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-342"><a href="#cite_note-342">[341]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/France_24" title="France 24">France 24</a> is a television news channel owned and operated by the French government, and is based in Paris.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-343"><a href="#cite_note-343">[342]</a></sup> Another news agency is France Diplomatie, owned and operated by the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ministry_of_Foreign_and_European_Affairs_(France)" title="Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs (France)">Ministry of Foreign and European Affairs</a>, and pertains solely to diplomatic news and occurrences.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-344"><a href="#cite_note-344">[343]</a></sup>
</p><p>The most-viewed network in France, <a href="/wiki/TF1" title="TF1">TF1</a>, is in nearby <a href="/wiki/Boulogne-Billancourt" title="Boulogne-Billancourt">Boulogne-Billancourt</a>. <a href="/wiki/France_2" title="France 2">France 2</a>, <a href="/wiki/France_3" title="France 3">France 3</a>, <a href="/wiki/Canal%2B" title="Canal+">Canal+</a>, <a href="/wiki/France_5" title="France 5">France 5</a>, <a href="/wiki/M6_(TV_channel)" title="M6 (TV channel)">M6</a> (<a href="/wiki/Neuilly-sur-Seine" title="Neuilly-sur-Seine">Neuilly-sur-Seine</a>), <a href="/wiki/Arte" title="Arte">Arte</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/D8_(TV_channel)" title="D8 (TV channel)">D8</a>, <a href="/wiki/W9_(TV_channel)" title="W9 (TV channel)">W9</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/NT1_(TV_channel)" title="NT1 (TV channel)">NT1</a>, <a href="/wiki/NRJ_12" title="NRJ 12">NRJ 12</a>, <a href="/wiki/La_Cha%C3%AEne_parlementaire" title="La Chaîne parlementaire">La Chaîne parlementaire</a>, <a href="/wiki/France_4" title="France 4">France 4</a>, <a href="/wiki/BFM_TV" title="BFM TV">BFM TV</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Gulli" title="Gulli">Gulli</a> are other stations located in and around the capital.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-345"><a href="#cite_note-345">[344]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Radio_France" title="Radio France">Radio France</a>, France's public radio broadcaster, and its various channels, is headquartered in Paris's <a href="/wiki/16th_arrondissement_of_Paris" title="16th arrondissement of Paris">16th arrondissement</a>. <a href="/wiki/Radio_France_Internationale" title="Radio France Internationale">Radio France Internationale</a>, another public broadcaster is also based in the city.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-346"><a href="#cite_note-346">[345]</a></sup> Paris also holds the headquarters of the <a href="/wiki/La_Poste_(France)" title="La Poste (France)">La Poste</a>, France's national postal carrier.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-347"><a href="#cite_note-347">[346]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notable_people">Notable people</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=59" title="Edit section: Notable people">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main page: <a href="/wiki/Category:People_from_Paris" title="Category:People from Paris">Category:People from Paris</a></div>
<ul><li>In lieu of such an article, the following may be helpful:

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_relations">International relations</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=60" title="Edit section: International relations">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span id="Twin_towns_.E2.80.93_sister_cities"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="Twin_towns_–_sister_cities">Twin towns – sister cities</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=61" title="Edit section: Twin towns – sister cities">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">See also: <a href="/wiki/List_of_twin_towns_and_sister_cities_in_France" title="List of twin towns and sister cities in France">List of twin towns and sister cities in France</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2816" data-file-width="2112" decoding="async" height="227" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG/170px-Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG/255px-Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dc/Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG/340px-Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG 2x" width="170"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Castro_Pretorio_-_Colonna_di_Parigi_alle_Terme_di_Diocleziano_1010023.JPG" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Column dedicated to Paris near the <a href="/wiki/Baths_of_Diocletian" title="Baths of Diocletian">Baths of Diocletian</a> in <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">Rome</a></div></div></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="3072" data-file-width="2304" decoding="async" height="227" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG/170px-Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG/255px-Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/48/Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG/340px-Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG 2x" width="170"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Park_de_la_Sorbonne.JPG" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Sculpture dedicated to Rome in the square Paul Painlevé in Paris</div></div></div>
<p>Since 9 April 1956, Paris is exclusively and reciprocally <a href="/wiki/Sister_city" title="Sister city">twinned</a> only with:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IR_348-0"><a href="#cite_note-IR-348">[347]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-349"><a href="#cite_note-349">[348]</a></sup>
</p>
<ul><li><span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy"><img alt="Italy" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1500" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/23px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/35px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/45px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">Rome</a>, 1956</li></ul>
<dl><dd><i>Seule Paris est digne de Rome; seule Rome est digne de Paris.</i> <span class="languageicon">(in French)</span></dd>
<dd><i>Solo Parigi è degna di Roma; solo Roma è degna di Parigi.</i> <span class="languageicon">(in Italian)</span></dd>
<dd>"Only Paris is worthy of Rome; only Rome is worthy of Paris."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-350"><a href="#cite_note-350">[349]</a></sup></dd></dl>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Other_relationships">Other relationships</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=62" title="Edit section: Other relationships">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Paris has agreements of friendship and co-operation with:<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-IR_348-1"><a href="#cite_note-IR-348">[347]</a></sup>
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Notes">Notes</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=64" title="Edit section: Notes">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1011085734">.mw-parser-output .reflist{font-size:90%;margin-bottom:0.5em;list-style-type:decimal}.mw-parser-output .reflist .references{font-size:100%;margin-bottom:0;list-style-type:inherit}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-2{column-width:30em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns-3{column-width:25em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns{margin-top:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns ol{margin-top:0}.mw-parser-output .reflist-columns li{page-break-inside:avoid;break-inside:avoid-column}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-alpha{list-style-type:upper-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-upper-roman{list-style-type:upper-roman}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-alpha{list-style-type:lower-alpha}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-greek{list-style-type:lower-greek}.mw-parser-output .reflist-lower-roman{list-style-type:lower-roman}</style><div class="reflist">
<div class="mw-references-wrap"><ol class="references">
<li id="cite_note-26"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-26">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text">The word was most likely created by Parisians of the lower popular class who spoke *argot*, then *parigot* was used in a provocative manner outside the Parisian region and throughout France to mean Parisians in general.</span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="References">References</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=Paris&amp;action=edit&amp;section=65" title="Edit section: References">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>

<li id="cite_note-City-96"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-City_96-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-City_96-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation encyclopaedia cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/443621/Paris" rel="nofollow">"Paris"</a>. <i>Encyclopædia Britannica Online</i>. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20130707083834/https://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/443621/Paris" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 7 July 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-Pariscouncil-116"><span class="mw-cite-backlink">^ <a href="#cite_ref-Pariscouncil_116-0"><sup><i><b>a</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Pariscouncil_116-1"><sup><i><b>b</b></i></sup></a> <a href="#cite_ref-Pariscouncil_116-2"><sup><i><b>c</b></i></sup></a></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://welections.wordpress.com/2014/03/22/election-preview-france-municipal-elections-2014-part-i/" rel="nofollow">"Election Preview: France Municipal Elections 2014 – Part I"</a>. <i>World Elections</i>. 22 March 2014. <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20161011211513/https://welections.wordpress.com/2014/03/22/election-preview-france-municipal-elections-2014-part-i/" rel="nofollow">Archived</a> from the original on 11 October 2016<span class="reference-accessdate">. </li>
<li id="cite_note-190"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-190">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1 cs1-prop-foreign-lang-source"><a class="external text" href="http://www.insee.fr/fr/methodes/default.asp?page=nomenclatures/agregatnaf2008/agregatnaf2008.htm" rel="nofollow">"La nomenclature agrégée – NA, 2008"</a> (in French). <li id="cite_note-281"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-281">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.insee.fr/fr/themes/detail.asp?reg_id=99&amp;ref_id=base-indic-cc-dipl-form" rel="nofollow">"Indicateurs départementaux et régionaux sur les diplômes et la formation en 2009"</a>. <link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1097025294" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="side-box side-box-right plainlinks sistersitebox">

<div class="side-box-image"><img alt="" class="noviewer" data-file-height="430" data-file-width="410" decoding="async" height="40" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/38px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/57px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/76px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png 2x" width="38"/></div>
<div class="side-box-text plainlist"><a href="/wiki/Wikisource" title="Wikisource">Wikisource</a> has the text of the <a href="/wiki/Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica_Eleventh_Edition" title="Encyclopædia Britannica Eleventh Edition">1911 <i>Encyclopædia Britannica</i></a> article "<span style="font-weight:bold;"><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/1911_Encyclop%C3%A6dia_Britannica/Paris" title="wikisource:1911 Encyclopædia Britannica/Paris">Paris</a></span>".</div></div>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Bois_de_Boulogne" title="Bois de Boulogne">Bois de Boulogne</a>

<ul><li><span style="position: relative; top: 0.2em;"><sup>1</sup></span> Also the capital of the <a href="/wiki/Kingdom_of_the_Netherlands" title="Kingdom of the Netherlands">Kingdom of the Netherlands</a></li>

<li><span style="position: relative; top: 0.2em;"><sup>3</sup></span> Located in Asia, with socio-political connections with Europe</li>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Olympic_Summer_Games_Host_Cities" title="Template:Olympic Summer Games Host Cities"><abbr style=";;background:none class="image" href="/wiki/File:Olympic_rings_without_rims.svg"><img alt="Olympic rings without rims.svg" data-file-height="158" data-file-width="342" decoding="async" height="14" Olympic Games">Summer Olympic Games</a> <a href="/wiki/List_of_Olympic_Games_host_cities" title="List of Olympic Games host cities">host cities</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd <li><b><a href="/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics" title="2008 Summer Olympics">2008</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/China" title="China"><img alt="China" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/fa/Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg/45px-Flag_of_the_People%27s_Republic_of_China.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Beijing" title="Beijing">Beijing</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1200" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> London</li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil"><img alt="Brazil" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="504" data-file-width="720" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/22px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/33px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/43px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 2x" width="22"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics" title="2020 Summer Olympics">2020</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Japan" title="Japan"><img alt="Japan" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/35px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/45px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> Tokyo<sup>[c3]</sup></li>
<li><i><b><a href="/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics" title="2024 Summer Olympics">2024</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/France" title="France"><img alt="France" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> Paris</i></li>
<li><i><b><a href="/wiki/2028_Summer_Olympics" title="2028 Summer Olympics">2028</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> Los Angeles</i></li>
<li><i><b><a href="/wiki/2032_Summer_Olympics" title="2032 Summer Olympics">2032</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia"><img alt="Australia" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="640" data-file-width="1280" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Brisbane" title="Brisbane">Brisbane</a></i></li></ul>
</div></div></td></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div><sup>[c1]</sup> Cancelled due to <a href="/wiki/World_War_I" title="World War I">World War I</a>; <sup>[c2]</sup> Cancelled due to <a href="/wiki/World_War_II" title="World War II">World War II</a>; <sup>[c3]</sup> Postponed to 2021 due to the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

</div></td><td class="navbox-list" style="border-left:2px solid #fdfdfd;padding:0px;text-align:left; padding-left:0.2em; white-space:nowrap;;;;width:10em;"><div>
<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Paralympics" title="2016 Summer Paralympics">2016</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Brazil" title="Brazil"><img alt="Brazil" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="504" data-file-width="720" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/22px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/33px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/05/Flag_of_Brazil.svg/43px-Flag_of_Brazil.svg.png 2x" width="22"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Rio_de_Janeiro" title="Rio de Janeiro">Rio de Janeiro</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2020_Summer_Paralympics" title="2020 Summer Paralympics">2020</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Japan" title="Japan"><img alt="Japan" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/23px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/35px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9e/Flag_of_Japan.svg/45px-Flag_of_Japan.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <i><a href="/wiki/Tokyo" title="Tokyo">Tokyo</a></i></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2024_Summer_Paralympics" title="2024 Summer Paralympics">2024</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/France" title="France"><img alt="France" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/23px-Flag_of_France.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/35px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/c/c3/Flag_of_France.svg/45px-Flag_of_France.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <i><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Paris</a></i></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2028_Summer_Paralympics" title="2028 Summer Paralympics">2028</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <i><a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">Los Angeles</a></i></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/2032_Summer_Paralympics" title="2032 Summer Paralympics">2032</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Australia" title="Australia"><img alt="Australia" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="640" data-file-width="1280" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/23px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/35px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg/46px-Flag_of_Australia_%28converted%29.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <i><a href="/wiki/Brisbane" title="Brisbane">Brisbane</a></i></li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="World&amp;#039;s_50_most-populous_urban_areas" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:World%27s_most_populous_urban_areas" title="Template:World's most populous urban areas"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:World%27s_most_populous_urban_areas" title="Template talk:World's most populous urban areas"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:World%27s_most_populous_urban_areas&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="World&amp;#039;s_50_most-populous_urban_areas" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em">World's 50 <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_cities" title="List of largest cities">most-populous urban areas</a></div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-list navbox-odd" colspan="2" style="width:100%;padding:0;background:transparent;color:inherit;"><div style="padding:0px;"><table class="navbox-columns-table" style="border-spacing: 0px; </div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Art galleries and museums</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><span class="uid"><a class="external text" href="https://www.ngv.vic.gov.au/explore/collection/artist/13498/" rel="nofollow">Victoria</a></span></li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Other</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><span class="uid"><a class="external text" href="http://id.worldcat.org/fast/1205283/" rel="nofollow">Faceted Application of Subject Terminology</a></span></li>
<li><span class="uid"><a class="external text" href="https://hls-dhs-dss.ch/fr/articles/006604" rel="nofollow">Historical Dictionary of Switzerland</a></span></li>
<li><span class="uid"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/MBAREA_(identifier)" title="MBAREA (identifier)">MusicBrainz</a> <a class="external text" href="https://musicbrainz.org/area/dc10c22b-e510-4006-8b7f-fecb4f36436e" rel="nofollow">area</a></span></li>
<li><span class="uid"><a class="external text" href="https://catalog.archives.gov/id/10045153" rel="nofollow">National Archives (US)</a></span>
